Sentencas: In this work, the perovskite-type La0.8Ce0.2FeO3 (LCF) is employed as a host oxide for the exsolution of ceria in air and the further doping on La site using Pr3+ (La0.7Pr0.1Ce0.2FeO3, LPCF) or Gd3+ (La0.7Gd0.1Ce0.2FeO3, LGCF) is used to achieve the exsolution of PrOx- and Gd2O3- doped ceria (PDC and GDC).
Titulo: Coke-resistant ferrite anode decorated with in-situ exsolved ceria for carbonaceous fuel oxidation

Sentencas: The exsolution of (doped) ceria is accompanied by the segregation of Fe2O3 that can promote fuel oxidation.
Titulo: Coke-resistant ferrite anode decorated with in-situ exsolved ceria for carbonaceous fuel oxidation

Sentencas: The resulting perovskites are used as potential anode materials for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Coke-resistant ferrite anode decorated with in-situ exsolved ceria for carbonaceous fuel oxidation

Sentencas: At 800 degrees C, the LPCF with 1 wt% Ni infiltration cell on a LSGM (La0.9Sr0.1Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-delta) electrolyte yields the lowest Rp (polarization resistance) value (0.11 omega cm2) and the highest cell performance (808 mW cm-2) in H2 fuel, but the cells with LCF and LGCF anode show a stable performance under hydrocarbon fuel conditions if Ni is infiltrated into the anode to assist the deprotonation.
Titulo: Coke-resistant ferrite anode decorated with in-situ exsolved ceria for carbonaceous fuel oxidation

Sentencas: The parameters controlling the exsolution of the doped ceria and the catalysis for the hydrocarbon reforming are analyzed, proposing an intriguing path to achieving the exsolution of complex oxide on the surface of perovskite for the construct of a hierarchical electrode/catalyst for the applications in fuel conversion.
Titulo: Coke-resistant ferrite anode decorated with in-situ exsolved ceria for carbonaceous fuel oxidation
